page.title: 08Fraserburgh Lifeboat
page.content: The Fraserburgh Lifeboat is called the R Hope Roberts.It is a Mark 1 solent class .It is 48 feet 6 inches long which is just over 16m. It has 2 deisel engines with a top speed of 9 knots. It was built in l969 and it cost Â£70 000. The lifeboat has a crew of 7 which are 2 Coxwain, 2 Mechanics and 3 crew members. It has a pool of l8-20 so it is never short of men. The lifeboat station was opened in l831. It's services are 312. The lives saved at 1.9.80 are 435. Its awards are 2 gold,6 silver , 7 bronze and the boat can be launched within 10-15 minutes of alarm. On the l7th May, l985 we are getting a new, faster boat called the "Douglas Currie", which is a mark 2 Solent class. Ready in August 1985 is Fraserburgh's new lifeboat the "City of Edinburgh". It is a Tyne class which goes 18-20 knots
